meanings.definition: Wawled (verb): to cry loudly and harshly
meanings.sent1: The baby wawled all night, keeping the whole house awake.
meanings.sent2: She wawled in pain when she stubbed her toe.
meanings.sent3: The cat wawled at the closed door, wanting to go outside.
meanings.sent4: The wind wawled through the trees, creating an eerie sound.
meanings.sent5: The child wawled with joy upon seeing the surprise birthday party.

meanings.definition: Wawled (adjective): having a loud and harsh cry
meanings.sent1: The wawled puppy attracted the attention of everyone in the park.
meanings.sent2: The wawled kitten was adopted by a kind family.
meanings.sent3: The wawled bird chirped noisily outside my window every morning.
meanings.sent4: The wawled alarm clock startled me awake every day.
meanings.sent5: The wawled thunderstorm made the whole neighborhood tremble with fear.
